Technology.title: Equatorial Guinea enforces yearlong internet outage for island that protested construction company
Technology.snippet: Residents of Annobón island in Equatorial Guinea have faced severe internet outages since complaining about dynamite explosions by a Moroccan construction company.

Tech Industry.title: Mobix Labs Files Form 425 With the SEC, Announces Intention to Launch Hostile Tender Offer for Peraso; Criticizes Recent Dilutive Financing and Efforts to Restrict Shareholder Communications
Tech Industry.snippet: Mobix Labs filed Form 425 with the SEC announcing its intention to commence a hostile exchange offer to acquire all outstanding shares of Peraso.

Information Technology.title: Parliamentary panel suggests licensing requirements for AI content creators
Information Technology.snippet: The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Communications and Information Technology has asked the government to devise legal frameworks for licensing AI content creators.

Information Technology.title: Light-powered Chip Makes AI 100 Times More Efficient
Information Technology.snippet: Researchers at the University of Florida have built a chip that could revolutionize AI by using light instead of electricity for a core AI function.

Information Technology.title: California Lawmakers Pass AI Safety Bill, Pending Newsom's Approval
Information Technology.snippet: The bill aims to increase transparency in AI development and has sparked debate within the industry.

Software.title: AI coding assistants speed delivery but multiply security risk
Software.snippet: AI coding assistants offer faster software development, but introduce amplified security risks.

Hardware.title: Apple Puts iPhone AI Hardware, Not Features, in Focus
Hardware.snippet: For businesses, network operators and the wider technology ecosystem, the latest iPhone portfolio reinforces Apple's role as both a hardware innovator and a central player in the gradual adoption of AI-capable smartphones.

Tesla.title: Tesla lands regulatory green light for Robotaxi testing in new state
Tesla.snippet: Tesla has officially received approval from the Nevada DMV to start testing autonomous vehicles (robotaxis) on public roads.

Apple Inc.title: Apple unveils iPhone 17 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro Max
Apple Inc.snippet: Apple unveils its latest generation of iPhones, featuring powerful performance and advanced camera capabilities.

Microsoft Corp.title: Microsoft avoids EU fine by agreeing to unbundle Teams from Microsoft 365
Microsoft Corp.snippet: Microsoft Corp. will change its business practices in the productivity software market to address antitrust concerns raised by the European Union.

Google.title: Google's Search Test Exposes How Little It Cares About News: Key Points To Know
Google.snippet: Google conducted a test removing news from search results for 1% of users in eight European markets for 2.5 months.  The experiment suggested that news is not important to Google's ad-based business.

Amazon.title: Amazon Tests GM BrightDrop EV Delivery Vans
Amazon.snippet: Amazon is testing General Motors' BrightDrop electric vans as part of its effort to reduce carbon emissions in its delivery operations.  The test involves a small number of vehicles and is part of a broader strategy to have 100,000 electric delivery vehicles on the road by 2030.

FTC.title: FTC Launches Investigation Into Big Tech Over AI Chatbot Safety For Children—Meta, OpenAI, Musk's xAI Among Targets
FTC.snippet: The Federal Trade Commission on Thursday launched an investigation into Alphabet, Meta, Elon Musk's xAI, OpenAI and other firms over how they safeguard children and teens from potentially negative impacts of their artificial intelligence chatbots.

GDPR.title: Study finds GDPR reduced value but increased cybersecurity
GDPR.snippet: A recent study looking at the effects of the European Union's General Data Protection Regulation found that companies required to comply with the act lost market value in the week it became enforceable but, at the same time, suffered fewer data breaches in the long term.

CCPA.title: California AG Issues Highest Fine to Date for CCPA Violations
CCPA.snippet: The California Office of the Attorney General (OAG) announced a settlement against Healthline, which included the largest CCPA settlement to date – $1.55 million.  The violations included failing to opt consumers out of the sharing of their personal information for targeted advertising, violating the Purpose Limitation Principle, failing to maintain CCPA-required contracts, and deceiving consumers about privacy practices.

Data Privacy.title: "1,500 Engineers Had Total Access to Everything": WhatsApp Security Chief Exposes Meta's Catastrophic Data Privacy Violations
Data Privacy.snippet: Former security chief Attaullah Baig accuses Meta of systemic security failures within WhatsApp, alleging that 1,500 engineers had unrestricted access to sensitive user data.

Antitrust.title: Antitrust cases against US tech giants
Antitrust.snippet: Five major antitrust cases from the Federal Trade Commission and the US Department of Justice are proceeding against major American technology companies.  These cases include actions against Google (search and ad tech), Apple, Amazon, and Meta.
